txt.en: Lost in the Shallow
Find the next sign of jetsam

'My... locket.

'My beloved.

'I am unable to return...

'This is who I am...'
Find where the trail ends
The journal speaks of a locket given by a loved one
Search for the final clue
The jetsam and debris continue its trail south
An herbal satchel found by the wandering spirit leaves trail leading to the north-west.
The jetsam seems to narrow and curve to the south-east
The trail led you to a wrecked boat in the shallows. It must have run aground during a horrible storm.
Search the nearby satchel
Follow the trail north-west
Talk to Heshla
The trail narrows even further to the east
Searching the wreckage, you find a water-logged journal. Perhaps this can help the wandering spirit.
Search the wreckage
You should search here, as the trail ends
You find a locket with a picture inside
The trail is getting thinner and harder to track. You must be getting closer.
There seems to be a trail of jetsam leading away from the first trail of herbs.
Examine the water-logged journal
More and more debris scatters the more south you wander.

The locket you found contains a small sketch of two people locked in an embrace. One of the people bears a striking resemblance to the wandering spirit. You should return this to the lost soul.\n\nHeshla can be found south-east of the wreckage.
Track the scattered jetsam
As the trail narrows, it leads you further into the shallows.
The soul seems to be at peace now...
Find the next pile of debris
It is filled with herbs. A scattered trail leads north-west
This must be the spirit's ship wreck...
The wandering soul seems to be muttering to itself. Perhaps you should search the vicinity for any clues as to its identity.

'The bright canopy...

'Razed by shrieks of light...

'A violent storm...

'Thrashing to...

'A loud crash...

'A point of no return...'
The wandering soul cannot rest peacefully. There must be something keeping it in this realm.
There seems to be a journal left behind
